name: Firefox - Change Progress Meter Color Example
description: This is an experiment with SVG filters. I can only recommend this for Windows 7 users who aren't using a custom theme. BUT, you can edit the values to your liking if you read the Notes section below. This affects the HTML5 progress and XUL progressmeter elements. This will change the default green progress meter into a blue one. After installing the style, you can see the change in appearance - https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/progress#Result
additional_info: Note: I don't know anything about SVG creation, this is made from scraps of other SVG code I found on the net. Change intercept value between -1 to 1 to adjust brightness. .1 , .2 , .3 for increased brightness, -.1 , -.2 for decreased brightness. feColorMatrix values will change the base color/hue. I believe values can go from 0 to 360. SVG source can be seen neatly formatted at http://pastebin.com/eWKpUVSL
